Description: Mould-made pottery plastic lamp in the form of a bull's head, with a filling-hole in the centre of the forehead, surrounded by a moulded edge. Between the horns is another hole, perhaps a thumb-grip. The oval nozzle projects from the bull's muzzle, and has a flat rim round the wick-hole. The raised base is pointed-oval in shape and flat below. Covered with a red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q607)
